description: After reviewing growing data gaps and pressure from system failures, Oksana Lintz privately decides to activate Halden’s hidden recovery protocol to restore erased residents, despite knowing it risks exposing BCI flaws.
Oksana executes the hidden protocol; backend logs show dormant profiles are restored without compliance tracking. She quietly notifies select Oversight colleagues of irregular reappearances.
Residents report the sudden reappearance of individuals once erased from the BCI system. Confusion and speculation spread as these 'ghosts' access city spaces without digital oversight.
Council holds emergency sessions. Lintz argues for transparency about the system’s limits, but Directorate demands immediate containment of the untracked population to stabilize authority.
Public demonstrations grow as citizens question BCI legitimacy and demand accountability for disappearances. Pressure mounts as stories from the ‘ghosts’ highlight deep flaws in the system.
